THE CRISIS

Every Year, Millions Face
Water Scarcity

Droughts don't appear overnight. They build silently — in rainfall deficits, depleting groundwater, and rising temperatures. The cost of late action is immeasurable.

Rising Temperatures

Average temperatures have risen 1.2°C in the last decade, accelerating evaporation and crop stress across vulnerable regions.

+1.2°C Decade Average Rise

Groundwater Depletion

Over 60% of monitored wells show declining water tables, threatening drinking water supply for rural communities.

60% Wells Declining

Population at Risk

3.4 million people in drought-prone regions face acute water shortage every summer without preemptive intervention.

3.4M People Affected
THE SOLUTION

From Raw Data to
Decisive Action

01

Data Ingestion

Satellite imagery, weather stations, IoT sensors, and ground reports feed into a unified data lake in real-time.

ISRO Satellite IMD Weather IoT Sensors
02

AI Analysis

Machine learning models analyze patterns, predict drought severity, forecast water demand, and identify vulnerable zones.

ML Models Forecasting Risk Scoring
03

Early Warning

Automated alerts reach district collectors, tehsildars, and water authorities with precise severity and recommended actions.

SMS Alerts Dashboard Mobile App
04

Smart Response

Optimized tanker routing, resource allocation, and community coordination prevent crisis before it escalates.

Route Planning Resource Mgmt Coordination
TAKE ACTION NOW

Prevention Over Reaction.
Planning Over Panic.

Join the network of forward-thinking authorities using data-driven drought management to protect communities before disaster strikes.

Early Warning Alerts

Real-time drought threat monitoring and automated early warning system

Today, 12:45 PM
CRITICAL
Beed District

High Water Stress Detected — Immediate Action Required

Water stress index has crossed threshold 85/100 in 12 villages of Beed tehsil. Underground water level dropped below 15ft. Estimated 23,000 people at risk of acute drinking water shortage within 7 days.

Today, 11:30 AM
CRITICAL
Osmanabad District

Supply Gap Forecasted — 72 Hour Window

AI models predict a supply-demand gap in Osmanabad block within 72 hours based on current consumption rate and no rainfall forecast. Reservoir levels at 12% capacity.

Today, 10:15 AM
WARNING
Latur District

Groundwater Decline Accelerating in 8 Villages

Monitoring wells show a 2.3m decline in groundwater levels over the past 30 days in the Ausa tehsil area. Current trajectory suggests crossing critical threshold in 14 days.

Today, 9:00 AM
WARNING
Jalna District

Rainfall Deficit Exceeds 40% — Kharif Crop Risk

Cumulative rainfall in Jalna district is -42% below normal. IMD forecast indicates no significant precipitation for the next 10 days. Crop insurance advisory recommended.

Yesterday, 5:30 PM
INFO
Nanded District

New Bore Well Commissioned — Capacity Added

A new community bore well has been commissioned in Biloli tehsil, adding 15,000 liters/day capacity. This addresses water needs for approximately 800 residents in the area.

Yesterday, 2:00 PM
INFO
Parbhani District

Tanker Fleet Deployment Complete — 15 Units Active

All 15 authorized water tankers for Parbhani district have been deployed and are operational. Full district coverage achieved with optimized routing.
